meanings.definition: The quality of being particularly good or worthy, especially so as to deserve praise or reward.
meanings.sent1: Her hard work and dedication have earned her much merit in the eyes of her boss.
meanings.sent2: The student's essay was full of merit and received a high grade.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to catch the laser pointer had a certain merit of entertainment.
meanings.sent4: His argument had enough merit to sway the jury in his favor.
meanings.sent5: The shining gold star symbolized the highest level of merit in the competition.

meanings.definition: A good quality or feature that deserves praise or reward.
meanings.sent1: The honesty of the young boy was a great merit in his character.
meanings.sent2: The chef's signature dish had a unique merit that set it apart from the rest.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful nature was a merit that brought joy to the whole family.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness towards others is a merit that shines brightly in her personality.
meanings.sent5: The painting's vibrant colors added a special merit to the art exhibition.

meanings.definition: To deserve or be worthy of.
meanings.sent1: She will merit a promotion for her exceptional performance at work.
meanings.sent2: His actions merit recognition for their positive impact on the community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey's antics certainly merit a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: The brave firefighter's heroic deeds merit our utmost respect.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop truly merits the long hike to reach it.
